byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Fort Worth, Richard Pérez-Peña from New York, and Azam Ahmed from Mexico City. Amisha Padnani contributed reporting from New York, and Jorge Olmos Contreras from Puerto Vallarta, Mexico.
byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and AZAM AHMED

abstract: Ethan Couch, Texas teenager facing jail time for killing four people in drunk driving accident, is arrested in Mexico with his mother Tonya after fleeing probation, setting stage for new trials; authorities are seeking transfer of Ethan's case from juvenile to adult court, move that would stiffen penalties; Tonya faces charges of hindering apprehension, punishable by 10 years in prison.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Couch, who was spared prison in a deadly drunken-driving case after his lawyers said he had psychological problems because of his family’s wealth, was arrested in Mexico.

headline.main: Ethan Couch, ‘Affluenza’ Teenager, Had Last Party Before Fleeing, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Young and Rich and Now Facing New Court Date

snippet: Mr. Couch, who was spared prison in a deadly drunken-driving case after his lawyers said he had psychological problems because of his family’s wealth, was arrested in Mexico.
